properties.name: Empire State Building
properties.description: Posted by Dukeboy22new york city, new yorkThe Empire State Building serves as a bouilding for businesses to use as space to run their companies. The building totals 1,454 feet in heighth which includes the lightning rod. It only took one year and forty-five days to build which was far ahead of scheduled. The entire price of the construction totalled 4,718,000 and 7,00,000 man hours were needed to complete the Empire State building. 57,000 tons of steel were used in the construction of the entire building. 17 million feet of telephone wire servicing the building and 5 people died in the construction of the Empire State Building. Close to 3,400 workers worked on the building during the peak hours of construction.

properties.name: Golden Gate Bridge
properties.description: Posted by Dukeboy22The Golden Gate Bridge was constructed in the 1930\'s. It is a very popular roadway that experiences many crossings a day. The fewest cossings recorded to date was totalled at 3,921 on January 6, 1982. On October 17, 1989 there were 162,414 recorded crossings on the Golden Gate Bridge. 33 workers were estimated to die during the construction of the bridge yet only 11 workers died during the construction. A safety net saved 19 workers and were then called members of the "Half Way to Hell" club. The cables that support the bridge are 7,260 feet long and are 38 and 3/8 inches in diameter. The painters chose international orange for the color of the bridge because it blends in with its setting.

properties.name: Grand Canyon
properties.description: Posted by Dukeboy22grand canyon californiaThe Grand Canyon is 18 miles wide and 27 miles long. It also is 5,000 feet deep and covers 1,218,376 acres of land. The Grand Canyon is one of the biggest canyons in the world surpassed by Barranca de Cabre in North Mexico. Hells Canyon in Idaho is also larger than the grand canyon. The canyon\'s walls are made up of rock, vallies, and cliffs. To take a trip to the bottom of the Grand Canyon takes two days on foot or camel. The canyon at its most vertical section is 6,000 feet vertical in heighth. In the Grand Canyon\'s gorge it contains mesas, buttes, and vallies. Millions of people have visited the Grand Canyon since 1917.

properties.name: Leaning Tower of Pisa
properties.description: Posted by Dukeboy22Pisa, ItalyThe Tower of Pisa is the bell tower for a cathedral. Its construction was started in 1173 and continued for about 200 years. The tower is famous for its tilt which happened absolutely on accident. The tower was made to be perfectly vertical but during construction started to lean. The workers did not see a problem a decided to keep building. The Leaning Tower of Pisa would still bee recognized as a great work of architecture. It is one of the most reknown buildings in all of Europe and because of its great beauty. The tower is about 183 feet tall and weighs 14,500 tons. It has aproximately 295 steps and has a leaning angle of 3.97 degrees.

properties.name: Liberty Bell
properties.description: Posted by Dukeboy22Philadelphia, PennsylvaniaThe first chime rang from the Liberty Bell in Philadelphia on July 8th 1776 as tradition tells. The popularity of the bell became great when abolitionists adopted the Liberty Bell as their symbol. The writing in the center of the bell reads, " By Order of the Assembly of the Province of Pensylvania for tbe State House in Philada". The infamous crack in the Liberty Bell is widely disagreed. There were hairline cracks on the bell but were bored out to prevent large damage. One thing that is a confirmed truth is that the first large crack was produced when the Liberty Bell was rung on Washington\'s birthday in 1846. Every July forth the bell is rung 13 times by the descendants of the declaration signers in rememberence of the patriots from the original 13 states.

properties.name: Mt. Rushmore
properties.description: Posted by Dukeboy22north dakotaFour of our most influential president\'s faces are carved into Mt. Rushmore. This is a memorial to what George Washington, Thomas Jefferson, Abraham Lincoln, and Theodore Rosevelt did for our country. The carvings can remind everyone that the impossible is possible. It is one of the most famous landmarks in our country and was difficult to create. Doane Robinson can be credited with the idea to attract more people to the Black Mountains of North Dakota. The first site for carving was too thin and could be easily eroded and that is when Mt. Rushmore came into the picture. Gultzon Borglum was the sculptor who etched the faces of the presidents into the mountains exterior. On July 2nd the carving was complete and the project had been finished and the mountain glowed with fireworks and rockets that illuminated the sky.

properties.name: Stonehenge
properties.description: Posted by Dukeboy22Stonehenge, EnglandThe Sonehenge,which is located in England, is thought to be have constructed 5,000 years ago. It was made by all manual labor and a large amount of workers. The tools that they used consisted of deer antlers and shoulderblades of cattles. It is believed that the large stones were moved by putting the stones on logs and rolled to the work site. The stones that were used were anywhere from 20 to 50 tons each. The stones of the outer circle are sacrsen stones and weigh aproximately 50 tons each. To put these large stones into place, the workers would raise the stones with a lever. Then, they would attach ropes to the stones. Lastly, the workers would put the stones into place. Large stones were moved by putting the stones on logs and rolled to the work site. The stones that were used were anywhere from 20 to 50 tons each. The stones of the outer circle are sacrsen stones and weigh aproximately 50 tons each. To put these large stones into place, the workers would raise the stones with a lever. Then, they would attach ropes to the stones. Lastly, the workers would put the stones into place.

properties.name: Taj Mahal
properties.description: Posted by Dukeboy22IndiaThe Taj Mahal was built in memory of Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan\'s deceased wife, Mumtaz Mahal. It is considered to be one of the greatest examples of Muhal architecture. In 1983 The Taj Mahal became a World Heritage Site according to the UNESCO. It is still a great tourism site because of all its features. The exterior of the building is covered in colorful paints and other cultural arts. The interior of the building consists of works of art and jali screens. These screens are used as windows for viewing of items in the building. The tomb has a great entrance that begins with high arches that lead to the tomb. The Taj Mahal is considered one of the eight wonders of the world.

properties.name: The Colosseum
properties.description: Posted by Dukeboy22Rome, ItalyThe official name of the Colosseum is the Flavian Ampitheatre. Its construction was started between the years of 70 A.D. and 76 A.D. and was headed by Emperor Vespasian. It was completed by his son Titus in 80 A.D. and was celebrated by 100 days of games. The roof was made of canvas and was raised and lowered by Roman sailors. 300 tons of iron hold the Colosseum together. 100,000 cubic feet of marble were used in the construction of the Colosseum. The marble was carried by 200 ox and was very heavy. The fighters fought on a ground covered with sand so their blood would be soaked up. Condemned criminals often fought either each other or some animals. During the Rennissance bull fighting was popular and one of the main events at the Colesseum.

properties.name: The White House
properties.description: Posted by Dukeboy22Washington D.CThe White House was built between the years 1792 and 1800. John Adams was the very first president to live in the White House and has been the home of each president since. A group of British soldiers burned the White House down during the War of 1812. The Oval Office was created during William Henry Taft\'s presidency. The White House is a six story structure which includes a ground floor and a state floor. It also consists of a second floor, a third floor, and a two story basement. There are 132 rooms and 35 bathrooms helping accomodate all residents in the White House. The White House is can be found at 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue NW in Washington D.C. The building was influenced by Leinster House in Dublin, Ireland and Chateau de Rastignac.
